title: Will 'smart watch' or other 'wearables' really replace smart phones? - Quora

response.answer_text: Until consumer electronics figure out the proper paradigm to use with wearable devices, this product category will never be broadly adopted by consumers. Until the release of the iPhone in 2007, consumer electronics companies kept trying to build wearable devices that used the paradigm of a desktop computer and a cursor. With its multi touch display, Apple found a way to use a device with fingers, and competitors were quick to follow their lead. At the moment, no one has yet created the “iPhone” of wrist computers. Companies are trying to build wrist devices that use the paradigm of a multi touch display, but for practical reasons the screen size of wrist computers has to be small. For a few years now, dictation and virtual assistant AI’s are working at a decent level, so sound input and output could lead the way to a new paradigm that doesn’t require to interact with a screen.  Note to the reader: If you enjoy reading about watches or the luxury industry, please upvote and follow me on Quora, Twitter or LinkedIn. I have been monitoring the watch industry since the turn of the 21st century, and after a position as Head of Design for the Longines Watch Co. I now run the agency Woodshores, where I help small, medium and big watch companies with their strategy, branding and portfolio management.

It is no doubt that technology has shown the best picture in shape of wearable like smart watches and it, goes without saying, that technology is gradually evolving and we have many surprises awaiting round the corner. However, to assume that smart watches or other wearable are about to replace smart phones is a mistake. No doubt Smart watches have many embedded functionalities similar to smart phones but there are certain applications which only a smart phone device can perform.  Smart wrist Watch  Smart Watch What are the few benefits derived from a smart phone over a smart watch??? The big screen of the mobile device is good to watch a film which your watch will fail to compete in.Playing games, browsing websites, writing mails, or using Microsoft office etc.all these functions are not possible on your wrist watch.Moreover the battery backup is poor.Currently, they are mobile phone companions and considered as mere accessories.The above-mentioned facts are few hindrances and there are many more that will prevent the smart watch from replacing your smart handset anytime soon.
